answers.answer: O wow that's far ahead! Maybe they'll test you for gestational diabetes sooner then the norm if he is really big right now. But maybe the measurements were just off by a long shot! Either way don't stress and good luck!
U might just be carrying high
I don't have gd.  An I feel like I'm carrying low, lots of pressure downstairs Lol
Fundal height isn't an accurate way to measure baby. You can be several weeks ahead or behind. At 33 weeks I measured 7 weeks behind and my baby was fine.
Wow then good luck if its a big baby I wish yu luck
Hmm OK. I've I could just have a lot of fluid too, but what if he is that big? Will they induce me?

Unless it was dire they probably wouldn't. 10 weeks early would require a decent NICU stay and likely breathing machines. There are dozens of things that can cause you to measure off. Fluid, but having the tape in the same spot each time, the position of the baby, your own weight gain, etc etc.IF he's weighing that much (which is doubtful) they'll hold off a bit and induce early, by c-section or maybe vaginal.
I see, Well that worries me less. I knew he would stay in nicu so I was hoping he could continue to bake:)
Fundal heights are almost always off.... I measured 3 weeks ahead and had a sono and she was the perfect weight..I think she was balled up when the measured my fundal height

I've measured way ahead with each of my pregnancies!! My first 3 girls were all over 9 lbs and this little guy is measuring the biggest!! Have been measuring 4 wks ahead with him for months now! He's expected to be at least 10 lbs! Had an u/s @ 36 wks n he weighed 8 lbs 2 oz !! Go in for my c-section in 12 more days!! Can't wait to see how big he is!! My hubby thinks he's gonna be 11 lbs, like he was!! ;-)

question: Im 30+6 an today I measured at 35 weeks.  I'm scheduled for a sono but was curious what happens if he weighs too much??
title: measuring a month ahead !!
